column1: The men were glad enough to get ashore
column2: for they have been cooped on the transports most of the time since April 22nd
column3: knocking about on the ocean. In that hot climate it is not over-agreeable to be on ship-board
column4: even with ample room to move about in; but when crowded as the men on transports are
column5: there is no end of discomfort.All Friday afternoon and evening the men worked away at their camp
column6: and were tired enough when they were ordered to turn in for the night.Every precaution was taken to guard against a surprise
column7: although no attack was expected. Saturday the men continued their work
column8: which was getting along finely and almost completed
column10: while a large number of men were hauling water up the hill
column12: who had been working hard all day
column13: were taking a swim in the bay
column14: there was suddenly heard the sharp crack of Mauser rifles
column15: and the men knew that the Spaniards were there.
